# gt_theme_pff { #gt_extras.gt_theme_pff }

```python
gt_theme_pff(gt, divider=None, spanners=None, rank_col=None)
```

Applies a Pro Football Focus (PFF)-inspired theme to a GT table.

This function styles a `GT` object with a look inspired by Pro Football Focus tables,
supporting custom spanners, dividers, and rank column highlighting.

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name     | Type                | Description                                                                | Default    |
|----------|---------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------|
| gt       | GT                  | An existing `GT` object.                                                   | _required_ |
| divider  | str \| None         | Zero or more column names to visually divide with a preceding border.      | `None`     |
| spanners | list\[str\] \| None | Optional list of spanners to style, as referenced by the `GT` spanner ids. | `None`     |
| rank_col | str \| None         | Optional single column name to highlight as a rank column.                 | `None`     |

## Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

| Name   | Type   | Description                                           |
|--------|--------|-------------------------------------------------------|
|        | GT     | The themed `GT` object, allowing for method chaining. |

## Examples {.doc-section .doc-section-examples}

```{python}
from great_tables import GT, md
from great_tables.data import gtcars
import gt_extras as gte

gtcars_mini = gtcars[["model", "year", "hp", "trq"]].head(5)

gt = (
    GT(gtcars_mini, rowname_col="model")
    .tab_stubhead(label=md("*Car*"))
    .tab_header(title="Car Collection")
)

gte.gt_theme_pff(gt, rank_col="trq")
```
